data.text:
We are setting up a new Datacentre and one of my projects is to learn, rollout and configure Nagios XI. I’ve been playing around for about a month now and am starting to learn my way around.

In my testing I had been using NRPE under XINETD. As when you follow the Nagios instructions for monitoring linux the provided download script installs it this way.

Our Sr. Production admin created the server templates to have NRPE installed only. On our original discussion he wanted to only use NRPE and not have to worry about installing the full package from Nagios that installs NRPE under XINETD.

After a few days of playing around I’ve figured out how to use NRPE only. In discussions with our Production admin he has now said that if I want to use the full Nagios install script he is ok with that or we can stick with just NRPE. The decision is up to me.

My questions spice heads is what is your recommendation? What are the benefits of one over the other.

Currently we are not using any automation software but are looking at puppet. So any changed I need to make to nrpe.cfg or xinetd.d will be made manually or by a script I create and run.

Any advice would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advanced. %uFEFF
